oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tennessee State Guard officer addresses soldiers at 2nd Brig. Officers' School
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A number of Tennessee State Guard officers seated in chairs beneath a tree listening to an officer. An old cabin on the property appears in the background of the photo.

Jacob McGavock Dickinson's Traveler's Rest Arabian Stud Farm (River Grange Farm) on Del Rio Pike in Franklin played host to two hundred members of the 2nd Infantry Brigade for a two-day field exercise May 19-20, 1945. This event also included the Officers' School pictured. The three regiments participating in the field exercise were commanded by Col. John M. Abernathy, Pulaski; Col. Walter K. Crawford, Cookeville; and Col. Victor H. Wilson, Nashville.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tennessee State Guard, 1941-1947
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Tennessee. Militia; Tennessee - History, Military; World War, 1939-1945
